item.title: Flytipping on Fenham Road, 11th August
item.description:
Left here for weeks. please regularly patrol this area rather than just waiting for reports. thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Marmont Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road surface , cracks and pot holes , loose manholes, 11th August
item.description:
This issue has been there for as long as I have lived at this property, the council continue to turn a blind eye. Road is very damaged and causing unsettle all through the day but mainly night with cars and buses driving over the cracks and it rattles and vibrates through my property . I invite you to have a look and feel it, as you keep closing the case the same day as ‘no further investigation’ I think it is really poor from bexley council

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on shopfront - Mama - Peckham High Street, 11th August
item.description:
Please remove the orange graffiti from the green painted areas

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Peckham High Street, Peckham, London

item.title: Drain cover on pavement broken, 11th August
item.description:
This drain cover has been broken for over 2 months. Just witnessed a small child put his foot down it and fall over.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Belsham Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road desperately needs renewing, case constantly closed within a hour, can’t be possibley investigated!!!!!, 11th August
item.description:
All day and night until the last bus runs, my house rattles to the bus schedule so every 10 mins all day, going both ways .have been reporting this for two years yet nothing done, Westwood lane has had new surface and not hook lane. Please take a look and don’t close the case again without looking into it. We all pay our taxes. This is keeping us up at night . The vibrations rattle glasses in the kitchen cuboard at the back of the house

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large damaged branch hanging from tree, danger to life., 11th August
item.description:

item.title: Road needs relaying has done for 7 years. causing disturbance through the night with traffic vibrations rattling my property, 11th August
item.description:
Large curbs on the pavement and cracks and curbs in the road poorly repaired . Trip hazard while crossing the road. Also the cracks when driven over by anything larger than a small car, my property vibrates throughout. Caused cracks on the front of my property, and sleepless nights for us and our young child!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish flytipped after collection time, 11th August
item.description:
Monday 11th Aug - Domestic rubbish on pavement outside 30/32 Cranley Gardens. This after the regular Monday morning collection despite there being cellar refuse storage at all properties in the street. Selfish as it is a trip hazard and attracts more rubbish to be flytipped by lazy households and passersby. It reduces the area, creates a mess as animals shred the rubbish at night and creates more work for the already stretched street cleaners.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Cranley Gardens, Brompton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
